text: Yermakovsky District () is an administrativeLaw #10-4765 and municipalLaw #13-3003 district (raion), one of the forty-three in Krasnoyarsk Krai, Russia. It is located in the south of the krai and borders with Karatuzsky District in the northeast, the Tuva Republic in the east and south, and with Shushensky District in the west and northwest. The area of the district is .Official website of Krasnoyarsk Krai. Information about Yermakovsky District Its administrative center is the rural locality (a selo) of Yermakovskoye. Population: 23,202 (2002 Census); The population of Yermakovskoye accounts for 40.9% of the district's total population. ==Geography== Most of the district's territory is located in the center of the Western Sayan Mountains. ==History== The district was founded on May 25, 1925. ==Government== As of 2015, the Head of the District is Mikhail A. Vigovsky. As of 2016, the District Council consists of twenty-one deputies.Charter, Article 18 ==References== ===Notes=== ===Sources=== * * * Category:Districts of Krasnoyarsk Krai Category:States and territories established in 1925
title: Yermakovsky District
